schema:name: Status of surface waters in England, 2019

schema:creator.schema:name: Department for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs

schema:isBasedOn.schema:headline: Status of surface waters in England

schema:variableMeasured: Percentage of water bodies assessed with corresponding status
notes: Results are based on the numbers of water bodies assessed and represent the achievement of good or better status (or potential for water bodies designated as artificial or heavily modified under the WFD Regulations). Ecological status (or potential) is assigned using various water, habitat and biological quality tests. Failure of any one individual test means that the whole water body fails to achieve good or better ecological status (or potential). This is known as the one-out-all-out principle. Further definitions of terms can be found at [Glossary - Catchment Data Explorer](https://environment.data.gov.uk/catchment-planning/help/glossary)

datatype.format: All surface water bodies|Coastal waters: Saltmarsh|Estuaries: Saltmarsh|Lakes: Phytoplankton|Rivers: Plants & algae|Rivers: Invertebrates
Ecological status, at good status|Ecological status, other|Biology, at good status|Biology, not at good status

columns.name: status
columns.schema:description: Status of water environment being assessed, as measured under the Water Environment (Water Framework Directive) (England and Wales) Regulations 2017 (the WFD Regulations)

columns.name: percentage
columns.schema:description: Percentage of water bodies assessed with corresponding status
